Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens freedom of speech.
Determining what constitutes misinformation is subjective and challenging.
No entity, including the government, should have the authority to decide what is true.
Free speech is essential for discovering the truth.
The legislation resembles actions taken by totalitarian governments.
Notable Quotes: No one has a monopoly on truth.
